measured_by: 7-point single-item Likert rating of anxiety for each trial
justification: During the task, “participants rated their levels of anxiety … using a 7-point Likert scale (i.e., ‘How anxious … were you on the previous trial?’; 1 = not at all, 7 = extremely).”

measured_by: 7-point single-item Likert rating of confidence for each trial
justification: The procedure states that participants provided a confidence rating after selected trials on “a 7-point Likert scale (i.e., ‘How … confident … were you on the previous trial?’).”

measured_by: 7-point single-item Likert rating of motivation for each trial
justification: In the same set of rating trials, participants answered “How … motivated were you on the previous trial?” on a 7-point Likert scale.

measured_by: Trait subscale (STAI-T) of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory
justification: After the MRT, “general (trait) anxiety was assessed by the trait subscale (STAI-T) of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (Spielberger et al., 1983).”

measured_by: Drift rate (v) parameter from hierarchical drift diffusion modeling
justification: The diffusion model description notes that “drift rate (v) … represents the efficiency of information processing of mental rotation stimuli,” and v was estimated via HDDM.

measured_by: Decision threshold boundary (a) parameter from hierarchical drift diffusion modeling
justification: The paper explains that the “decision threshold boundary (a) … represents the amount of evidence needed to judge a same/different choice,” with a obtained from HDDM fits.
